bug.summary: UnicodeEncodeError with fairseq-generate on Devanagari characters
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
A is raised when trying to translate source text with Devanagari (presumably any Unicode) text with . The error is raised <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/894ae64858b62927d849c0fbc05e8f55d680a4f1/fairseq_cli/generate.py#L33>this line</denchmark-link> of fairseq_cli/generate.py: . It can be fixed by just adding a to the call. The PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/pull/460>#460</denchmark-link> addressed this issue for a bunch of other call sites of , but not this one (perhaps it didn't exist at the time). That PR also mentions inconsistencies between platforms, therefore I think this is just an issue on Windows. I'm happy to make a PR if this is the right fix. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run "fairseq-generate ..." with a source language that contains Devanagari characters
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
No error is raised. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version: master PyTorch Version: 1.4.0 OS: Windows How you installed fairseq : pip install git+https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq Python version: 3.6.8 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.2
